meanings.definition: The state of being surety for another.
meanings.sent1: His suretyship for his friend's loan helped him secure the money.
meanings.sent2: The suretyship agreement required him to pay back the debt if his friend couldn't.
meanings.sent3: When he jokingly offered his suretyship for the pizza delivery, the cashier laughed.
meanings.sent4: Her suretyship in the group project was like being the captain of a ship in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The suretyship of the parent for the child's behavior was evident in the strict rules set at home.

meanings.sent1: Taking on suretyship means being accountable for someone else's actions.
meanings.sent2: The suretyship of the guarantor was to ensure the debt would be paid.
meanings.sent3: The suretyship of the babysitter was to keep the children safe and entertained.
meanings.sent4: Her suretyship in the play was like being the lead actor responsible for the success of the show.
meanings.sent5: The suretyship of the coach was evident in the team's discipline and performance on the field.
